item.title: Transformation Priority Premise: overcome the fear of new tests
item.description: The Transformation Priority Premise (TPP) is a great empirical list of transformations that you can apply in your code when you’re working in TDD: When do you need it? Practicing with TDD I realized that sometimes I reach a point when I get stuck: I am almost scared to add a new particular test because I already know it’s going to force me to completely rewrite the structure of the code.

item.title: The Paradox Of Choice In Learning to Code
item.description: I was talking with a guy some days ago and it went like this: he told me “I really would like to start improving myself and I need a pet project..“ I said “great idea! But where do you want to improve?“ he said “..that’s the problem: I still don’t know what I want to use. There are so many things out there that I would like to learn … and I don’t know where to start…“ This made me think about a book I read some time ago called “The Paradox of Choice: Why More Is Less” (the author gave also an awesome TED Talk about it).
